name: CreateTimeEntry
description:
Create a new time entry for tracking work.

Use this tool to log a new time entry for a specific team. If the duration is negative, it indicates that a timer is running for the user.

parameters.name: team_id_numeric
parameters.description: The numeric ID of the workspace. Required if referencing a task by custom task ID.

parameters.name: time_entry_details
parameters.description: JSON object providing details for the time entry, including 'description', 'start', 'stop', 'tags', 'billable', 'assignee', 'tid'.

tags.description: Users on the Business Plan and above can include a time tracking label.

stop.description: The `duration` parameter can be used instead of the `stop` parameter.

duration.description: When there are values for both `start` and `end`, `duration` is ignored. The `stop` parameter can be used instead of the `duration` parameter.

assignee.description: Workspace owners and admins can include any user id. Workspace members can only include their own user id.

value_schema.description: Associate a time entry with a task using the `tid` parameter.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: Required if `custom_task_ids` is true. Provide the Workspace ID for the team.

value_schema.description:
When the `custom_task_ids` parameter is set to `true`, the Workspace ID must be provided using the `team_id` parameter.
 \
For example: `custom_task_ids=true&team_id=123`.

parameters.name: use_custom_task_ids
parameters.description: Set to true to reference a task by its custom task id.

value_schema.description: If you want to reference a task by it's custom task id, this value must be `true`.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the clickup API.

parameters.name: custom_task_ids
parameters.description: If you want to reference a task by it's custom task id, this value must be `true`.

value_schema.description: If you want to reference a task by it's custom task id, this value must be `true`.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description:
When the `custom_task_ids` parameter is set to `true`, the Workspace ID must be provided using the `team_id` parameter.
 \
For example: `custom_task_ids=true&team_id=123`.

value_schema.description:
When the `custom_task_ids` parameter is set to `true`, the Workspace ID must be provided using the `team_id` parameter.
 \
For example: `custom_task_ids=true&team_id=123`.

parameters.name: requestBody
parameters.description: Associate a time entry with a task using the `tid` parameter.

tags.description: Users on the Business Plan and above can include a time tracking label.

stop.description: The `duration` parameter can be used instead of the `stop` parameter.

duration.description: When there are values for both `start` and `end`, `duration` is ignored. The `stop` parameter can be used instead of the `duration` parameter.

assignee.description: Workspace owners and admins can include any user id. Workspace members can only include their own user id.

value_schema.description: Associate a time entry with a task using the `tid` parameter.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
